Class ServerResponse

extends java.lang.Object

    Get Response from server - ServerResponse.java

    The ServerResponse class was created to validate a given URL.

    Note: The URL given must be an a valid form.

    • Method Detail

      • response

        public static java.lang.String response(java.net.URL url)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Being the only method of this class, ServerResponse.response method checks whether or not a URL is valid (NOT Valid Example: Error 404 Not Found)

        Creates a connection with the server and gets a response message.

      • If the message is "OK", that means that the URL is valid and our LinkRetrieve acts accordingly.
      • If the message is "Not Found", then obviously the URL content is not valid and our LinkRetrieve acts accordingly

Parameters:
url - The URL that is retrieved from the LinkRetrieve Class.
Returns:
response Is a string "OK" or "Not Found" based on the response message from the server.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Input/Output Exception
